description: This function generates a visual representation of a set of lines, defined by their slopes and y-intercepts, on a 2D plane. It is designed for educational purposes, particularly for teaching and learning about the concepts of parallel and perpendicular lines in geometry.

stimulus_type_specification.title: Available Images: Parallel and Perpendicular Lines
stimulus_type_specification.description: This function can draw a variety of lines on a 2D plane, defined by their slopes and y-intercepts. It accepts a list of line objects as input, each of which includes a label (a string of exactly two uppercase letters), a slope, and a y-intercept. The function validates the label of each line, ensuring that it consists of exactly two uppercase letters. The lines are drawn within a range of x values from -6 to 6. This function is particularly useful for visualizing the concepts of parallel and perpendicular lines in geometry, as it allows for the clear comparison of different lines' slopes and positions.

details: line_list: A list of line objects, each of which includes a label, a slope, and a y-intercept
label: A string of exactly two uppercase letters representing the line
slope: A numerical value representing the slope of the line
y_intercept: A numerical value representing the y-intercept of the line
The label of each line must consist of exactly two uppercase letters
The lines are drawn within a range of x values from -6 to 6
The function generates a 2D plot of the input lines
Each line is represented by a straight line segment extending from x = -6 to x = 6
The slope and position of each line are determined by the input parameters
